translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ای جامه برخود پوشیده!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى جامه در سر كشيده،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: هان، اى جامه بر خود كشيده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اى كشيده رداى شب بر سر،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: الا ای رسولی که خود را به لباس (حیرت و فکرت) در پیچیده‌ای.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ای جامه بر سر کشیده (و در بستر خواب آرمیده!). [[«مُدَّثِّرُ»: کسی که جامه بر سر کشیده باشد. اصل آن (الْمُتَدَثِّرُ) است. مخاطب پیغمبر اسلام است که از تمسخر کفّار و سخنان ناروای ایشان به خانه خود رفته و جامه‌ای بر سر می‌کشد، و یا به بستر می‌رود. امّا فرمان آسمانی او را به جدّ و جهد در کار تبلیغ می‌خواند. یا مراد جامه نبوّت و پیغمبری است (نگا: قاسمی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ای مرد جامه بر خود پیچیده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ای جامه خواب به خود پیچیده (و در بستر آرمیده)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ای به جامه خواب‌رفته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اى جامه به خود پيچيده- يا اى جامه بسركشيده-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ای خموش در خود فرورفته (و) خویشتن را پوشیده‌،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: O YOU ENFOLDED in your mantle (of reform),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: O the Cloaked One! (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: O thou shrouded in thy mantle,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: O thou enveloped?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: O you (Muhammad SAW) enveloped (in garments)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: O you Enrobed one.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: O you enveloped in your cloak!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: O you enveloped in garments!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: O thou enveloped in thy cloak,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: O you wrapped up in your mantle!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: O you (Prophet Muhamad), the cloaked,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: O you who covers himself [with a garment],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Cloaked one,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: O you who are clothed!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ya ayyuha almuddaththiru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: O, you, wrapped in your cloak,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برخیز و بیم ده،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: برخيز و بيم ده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: برخيز و بترسان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: برخيز و بترسان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: برخیز و به اندرز و پند، خلق را خدا ترس گردان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برخیز و (مردمان را از عذاب یزدان) بترسان! [[«قُمْ»: برخیز. کوشا باش! (نگا: قاسمی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برخیز و هشدار ده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: برخیز و انذار کن (و عالمیان را بیم ده)،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بپای شو پس بترسان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: برخيز و بيم كن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: برخیز، پس هشدارده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Arise and warn,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Rise up and warn!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: arise, and warn!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Arise, and warn.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Arise and warn!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Arise and warn.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Arise, and warn,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Arise and warn!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Arise and warn!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Rise up and warn!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: arise and warn,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Arise and warn

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: stand up, deliver your warning,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Arise and warn,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qum faan<u>th</u>ir

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: arise and give warning!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Arise and deliver thy warning!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پروردگارت را بزرگ دار،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و پروردگارت را تكبير گوى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و پروردگار خود را به بزرگى ياد كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پروردگار خود را بزرگ دار.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدایت را به بزرگی و کبریایی یاد کن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و تنها پروردگار خود را به بزرگی و کبریائی بستای (و تنها او را بزرگ بشمار). [[«کَبِّرْ»: به عظمت و کبریائی یاد کن (نگا: اسراء / 111).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و پروردگارت را تکبیر گوی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پروردگارت را بزرگ بشمار،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پروردگار خویش را بزرگ شمر

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و پروردگارت را به بزرگى ياد كن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و پروردگارت را (نزد دیگران که کوچکش داشته‌اند) بزرگ گردان‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Glorify your Lord,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And proclaim the Purity of your Lord.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thy Lord magnify

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thine Lord magnify!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And your Lord (Allah) magnify!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And magnify your Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and magnify the glory of your Lord,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And magnify your Lord!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thy Lord magnify,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Magnify your Lord,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and exalt your Lord,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And your Lord glorify

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: proclaim the greatness of your Lord,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And your Lord do magnify,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Warabbaka fakabbir

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Proclaim the glory of your Lord;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And thy Lord do thou magnify!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و جامه ات را پاک کن،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و جامه‌ات را پاكيزه دار.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و جامه‌ات را پاكيزه دار

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و لباس خويشتن را پاك كن.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و لباس (جان و تن) خود را از هر عیب و آلایش پاک و پاکیزه دار.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و جامه‌ی خویش را پاکیزه دار (و خویشتن را از آلودگیها پاک گردان). [[«ثِیَاب»: جمع ثَوْب: جامه. هم جامه ظاهری مراد است و هم جامه باطنی، یعنی عمل. چرا که اعمال هرکس به منزله لباس او است، و ظاهر هر شخص بیانگر باطن او است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و دامنت را پاکیزه بدار

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و لباست را پاک کن،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و جامه‌های خویش را پاک ساز

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و جامه خويش را پاك ساز

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و لباس‌هایت را پاک بدار.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Purify your inner self,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And keep your clothes clean.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: thy robes purify

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thine raiment purify.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And your garments purify!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And purify your clothes.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and purify your robes,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And purify your garments!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thy raiment purify,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and purify your clothes,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and purify your clothing,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And your clothing purify

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: cleanse your clothes,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And your garments do purify,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wathiy<u>a</u>baka fa<u>t</u>ahhir

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: purify your garments;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And thy garments keep free from stain!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از پلیدی دور شو

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از پليدى دورى گزين.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از پليدى دورى كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از پليدى دور شو.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و از ناپاکی (بت و بت‌پرستان) به کلی دوری گزین.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و از چیزهای کثیف و پلید دوری کن. [[«الرُّجْزَ»: چیزهای کثیف و پلید. وسوسه و نیرنگ اهریمن. بتها. گناه. این واژه مفهوم جامعی دارد و هرگونه عمل زشت و پلید و هر کاری را شامل می‌شود که موجب خشم و عذاب الهی باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از آلایش [شرک‌] بپرهیز

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از پلیدی دوری کن،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و چرک را دوری گزین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از عذاب دورى گزين

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از (هرگونه) پلیدی دور شو.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And banish all trepidation.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And stay away from idols.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and defilement flee!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And pollution shun.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And keep away from Ar-Rujz (the idols)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And abandon abominations.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and shun uncleanness,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And keep away from Ar-Rujz!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Pollution shun!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and keep away from all impurity!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and flee from the statues!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And uncleanliness avoid

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: stay away from sins

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And uncleanness do shun,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalrrujza faohjur

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: shun uncleanness;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And all abomination shun!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [احسانت را بر دیگران] در حالی که [آن را] بزرگ و فراوان بینی، منت مگذار،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و چيزى مده كه بيش از آن چشم داشته باشى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [براى احسانت‌] منّت نگذار و آن را زياد مشمار

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و منّت مگذار و فزونى مطلب.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر هر که احسان کنی ابدا منّت مگذار و عوض افزون مخواه.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بذل و بخشش برای این مکن که افزون‌طلبی کنی. (بلکه برای رضای خدا احسان و صدقه و بذل و بخشش کن). [[«لا تَمْنُنْ»: عطاء مکن. (مَنّ) در اینجا به معنی انعام و اعطاء است (نگا: ص / 39). «تَسْتَکْثِرُ»: افزون می‌خواهی. بیشتر می‌طلبی. فاعل آن ضمیر مستتر (انت) است. جمله فعل و فاعل، حال است. مراد این است که احسانگر برای این ندهد تا بیشتر بگیرد و افزون‌طلبی کند (نگا: روم / 39).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بخششی مکن که پاداش [و پاسخ‌] بزرگتریابی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و منّت مگذار و فزونی مطلب،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و منّت منه که فزونی جوئی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چيزى به كسى مده كه بيشتر بستانى- يا منّت مَنِه كه كارت را بزرگ شمارى يا فزونى جويى-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و منت مگذار در حالی که فزونی‌طلب و برتری‌جویی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do not bestow favours in expectation of return,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And do not favour others in order to receive more.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Give not, thinking to gain greater

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And bestow not favour that thou mayest receive more.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And give not a thing in order to have more (or consider not your deeds of Allah's obedience as a favour to Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And show no favor seeking gain.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And give not a thing in order to have more.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And show not favour, seeking wordly gain!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do not grant a favour seeking a greater gain,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not give, thinking to gain greater

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And do not confer favor to acquire more

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and do not think that by doing such deeds, you have done a great favor to God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And bestow not favors that you may receive again with increase,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala tamnun tastakthiru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: do not bestow a favour in the expectation of receiving more in return;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [بر آزار دشمنان] برای پروردگارت شکیبایی ورز.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: براى پروردگارت صابر باش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و براى پروردگارت شكيبا باش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و براى پروردگارت شكيبايى كن.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و برای خدایت صبر و شکیبایی پیش‌گیر.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و برای (خوشنودی و محض رضای) پروردگارت شکیبائی کن. [[«لِرَبِّکَ»: برای رضای پروردگارت. به خاطر پروردگارت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در راه پروردگارت شکیبایی کن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بخاطر پروردگارت شکیبایی کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برای پروردگار خویش بشکیب‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و براى پروردگارت شكيبايى ورز.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برای پروردگارت شکیبایی کن.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And persevere in the way of your Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And for the sake of your Lord, patiently endure.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and be patient unto thy Lord.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And for the good-will of thy Lord be thou patient.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And be patient for the sake of your Lord (i.e. perform your duty to Allah)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And be constant for your Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and persevere for your Lord's sake.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And be patient for the sake of your Lord!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For the sake of thy Lord, be patient!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: be patient unto your Lord.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But for your Lord be patient.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Exercise patience to please your Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And for the sake of your Lord, be patient.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walirabbika faisbir

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and for the sake of your Lord, be patient.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But, for thy Lord's (Cause), be patient and constant!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس زمانی که در صور دمیده شود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنگاه كه در صور دميده شود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس چون در صور دميده شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون در صور دميده شود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا آن‌گاه که (هنگامه قیامت برپا شود و) در صور (اسرافیل) بدمند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مرا با کسی که او را به تنهایی آفریدم واگذار،

translations.text: مرا با آن كه تنهايش آفريده‌ام واگذار.

translations.text: مرا واگذار با آن كس كه [او را] تنها آفريدم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مرا با آنكه [او را] تنها آفريدم واگذار.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به من واگذار کار انتقام آن کس را که من او را تنها آفریدم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مرا واگذار با آن کسی که او را تک و تنها (و بدون دارائی و اموال و اولاد) آفریده‌ام. [[«وَحِیداً»: تک و تنها. مراد بدون اموال و اولاد است. اشاره به ولید پسر مُغیره است که یکی از افراد سرشناس مکّه بود و برای اذیّت و آزار مؤمنان تلاش بسیار می‌کرد. در اینجا هر کافر و منافقی مراد است که برای جلوگیری از اسلام و اذیّت مسلمانان در تک و تاز باشد. واژه (وَحِیداً) می‌تواند حال مفعول محذوفی، یا حال فاعل باشد. معنی دیگر آیه: مرا واگذار با کسی که تنها خودم او را آفریده‌ام. مرا تنها واگذار با کسی که او را آفریده‌ام (که برای عذاب و عقاب او من کافی و بسنده‌ام).]]

translations.text: و به او مال و ثروت فراوان بذل کردم.

translations.text: و ثروت بسیاری بدو داده‌ام. [[«مَمْدُوداً»: گسترده. فراوان.]]

translations.text: And sons present by his side.

translations.text: And children present [with him]

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and made all things smooth for him;

translations.text: And smoothed things for him.

translations.text: and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),

translations.text: And made life smooth and comfortable for him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And made (life) smooth for him.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گذشته از این (بدون شکر و سپاسی که بکند) امیدوار است که (بر نعمت و قدرتش) بیفزایم! [[«ثُمَّ»: گذشته از این. سپس.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز طمع دارد که افزونتر کنم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: باز هم طمع دارد که بر او بیفزایم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس امید دارد که بیفزایم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و باز طمع دارد كه [مال و فرزندان او را] بيفزايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس طمع دارد که (برآن) بیفزایم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet he wants that I should give him more.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Yet he desires that I should give more.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then he is eager that I should do more.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And who yet coveteth that shall increase.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: After all that he desires that I should give more;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he wants Me to add yet more!

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: After all that he desires that I should give more.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Yet he desireth that I should give more.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Still he is eager that I should give him more.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: yet he is eager that I increase him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then he desires that I should add more.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and who still desires more.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And yet he desires that I should add more!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma yatmaAAu an azeeda

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and yet, he greedily desires that I give him even more!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Yet is he greedy-that I should add (yet more);-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین نیست؛ زیرا او همواره به آیات ما دشمنی می ورزد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آرى، كه او در برابر آيات ما ستيزه‌جوست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: حاشا! همانا او نسبت به آيات ما عناد دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ولى نه، زيرا او دشمن آيات ما بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هرگز (بر نعمتش نیفزایم) که او با آیات ما دشمنی و عناد ورزید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگز! (چنین نخواهد شد و بدانچه آرزو می‌کند نخواهد رسید). چرا که با آیات ما دشمن و ستیزه‌جو است. [[«عَنِیداً»: مخالف. ستیزه‌گر (نگا: هود / 59، ابراهیم / 15، ِ / 24).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حاشا، که او به آیات ما ستیزه‌جوست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز چنین نخواهد شد؛ چرا که او نسبت به آیات ما دشمنی می‌ورزد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است همانا او است آیتهای ما را دشمن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هرگز، زيرا كه او با آيات ما- سخنان و نشانه‌هاى ما- ستيهنده بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هرگز چنان نیست (که می‌پندارد). او بی‌امان دشمن آیات ما بوده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Never. He is refractory of Our signs.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Never! For he is an enemy to Our signs!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay! He is forward unto Our signs;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! Verily he hath been Unto Our signs a foe.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay! Verily, he has been stubborn and opposing Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By no means! He was stubborn towards Our revelations.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay! Verily, he has been opposing Our Ayat.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay! For lo! he hath been stubborn to Our revelations.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No indeed! He is an obstinate opponent of Our signs.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Not at all! Surely, he has been disobedient to Our verses.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Never will he receive more. He has been hostile to Our revelations.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By no means! surely he offers opposition to Our communications.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla innahu kana liayatina AAaneedan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By no means! He has been stubbornly hostile to Our revelation:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به زودی او را به بالا رفتن از گردنه عذابی بسیار سخت مجبور می کنم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او را به مشقتى مى‌اندازم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: زودا كه او را به بالا رفتن از گردنه [ى عذاب‌] وادار كنم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به زودى او را به بالارفتن از گردنه [عذاب‌] وادار مى‌كنم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به زودی او را به سختی و دشواری (آتش دوزخ) درافکنم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به زودی او را به بالا رفتن از گردنه (ی مشکلات و معضلات زندگی) وامی‌دارم (و به سختیها و دشواریهای فراوان دچار می‌سازم). [[«سَأُرْهِقُهُ»: او را وادار می‌کنم (نگا: کهف / 73 و 80). «صَعُوداً»: گردنه سخت و بلند. مراد مبتلا ساختن به سختیها و دشواریها و واداشتن به مشقّتها و ناگواریها و دردها و رنجها است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که مشقتی سنگین بر او تحمیل کنم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بزودی او را مجبور می‌کنم که از قلّه زندگی بالا رود (سپس او را به زیر می‌افکنم)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: زود است رسانمش به عذابی سخت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: زودا كه او را به سختى و دشوارى- عذاب- افكنم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به زودی او را به بالا رفتن از گردنه‌ا‌ی سخت وادار می‌کنم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I shall inflict on him hardship,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Soon I shall mount him on Saood, the hill of fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and I shall constrain him to a hard ascent.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Anon I shall afflict him with a fearful woe.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: I shall oblige him to (climb a slippery mountain in the Hell-fire called As-Sa'ud, or to) face a severe torment!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I will exhaust him increasingly.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: I shall force him to Sa`ud!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On him I shall impose a fearful doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Soon I will overwhelm him with hardship.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I will constrain him to a hard ascent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: I will cover him with arduous torment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We shall make him suffer the torment of hell without relief.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I will make a distressing punishment overtake him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Saorhiquhu saAAoodan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I shall force him to endure a painful uphill climb!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Soon will I visit him with a mount of calamities!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: او [برای باطل کردن دعوت قرآن] اندیشید و [آن را] سنجید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او انديشيد و طرحى افكند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا او [براى مبارزه با قرآن‌] فكر كرد و سنجيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آرى، [آن دشمن حق‌] انديشيد و سنجيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اوست که فکر و اندیشه بدی کرد (که رسول خدا را به سحر و ساحری نسبت داد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او (برای مبارزه‌ی با پیغمبر و قرآن) بیندیشید (و در نظر گرفت که چه بگوید و بکند) و نقشه و طرحی را (در ذهن خود) آماده ساخت. [[«قَدَّرَ»: تعیین کرد. پیش چشم داشت. طرح‌ریزی کرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چرا که او اندیشید و سگالید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او (برای مبارزه با قرآن) اندیشه کرد و مطلب را آماده ساخت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا او اندیشید و سنجید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: وى انديشيد و اندازه كرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌‌چون (آن دشمن بداندیش) اندیشید و سنجید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For he had thought and calculated.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed he thought, and inwardly decided.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Lo! He reflected, and determined --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily he considered, and devised.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, he thought and plotted;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He thought and analyzed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He reflected and then hatched a scheme.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, he thought and plotted.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For lo! he did consider; then he planned -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed he reflected and decided.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He reflected, and then determined

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, he thought and deliberated.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He planned and plotted.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely he reflected and guessed,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahu fakkara waqaddara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: For he thought and he plotted --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For he thought and he plotted;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس مرگ بر او باد، چگونه سنجید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مرگ بر او باد، چگونه طرحى افكند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس مرگ بر او، چگونه سنجيد؟ [و تصميم گرفت.

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كشته بادا، چگونه [او] سنجيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدایش بکشد که چقدر اندیشه غلطی کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مرگ بر او باد! چه نقشه‌ای که کشید و چه طرحی که ریخت؟! [[«قُتِلَ»: مرگ بر او! کشته و نابود باد! برای تعجّب است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس مرگ بر او باد چگونه سگالید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مرگ بر او باد! چگونه (برای مبارزه با حق) مطلب را آماده کرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس کشته شود چگونه سنجید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس مرگ بر او باد، چگونه اندازه كرد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (این) کشته(ی هوا و عِناد خود)، چگونه سنجید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: May he be accursed, how he planned!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So accursed be he, how evilly did he decide!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: death seize him, how he determined!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Perish he! How moliciously he devised!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So let him be cursed! How he plotted!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: May he perish, how he analyzed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So let him be cursed, how he plotted!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Self-)destroyed is he, how he planned!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Perish he, how he decided!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: death seized him, how was his determining!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: May he be condemned!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But may he be cursed how he plotted;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqutila kayfa qaddara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and woe to him; how he plotted!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And woe to him! How he plotted!-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: باز هم مرگ بر او باد، چگونه سنجید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: باز هم مرگ بر او باد، چگونه طرحى افكند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: باز هم مرگ بر او، چگونه سنجيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آرى،] كشته بادا، چگونه [او] سنجيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز هم خدایش بکشد که چه فکر خطایی نمود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: باز مرگ بر او باد! چه نقشه‌ای که کشید و چه طرحی که ریخت؟! [[«ثُمَّ»: تکرار برای مبالغه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز مرگ بر او باد چگونه سگالید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: باز هم مرگ بر او، چگونه مطلب (و نقشه شیطانی خود را) آماده نمود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس کشته شود چگونه سنجید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: باز هم مرگ بر او باد، چگونه اندازه كرد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس کُشته شد. چگونه سنجید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: May be then be accursed, how he plotted!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Again accursed be he, how evilly did he decide!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Again, death seize him, how he determined!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And again perish he! How maliciously he devised!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And once more let him be cursed, how he plotted!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Again: may he perish, how he analyzed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Again, ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And once more let him be cursed, how he plotted!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Again (self-)destroyed is he, how he planned! -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Again, perish he, how he decided!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Again, death seized him, how was his determining!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: What an evil plan he has made!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Again, may he be cursed how he plotted;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma qutila kayfa qaddara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Let him be destroyed. How he calculated!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Yea, Woe to him; How he plotted!-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه نظر کرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه نگريست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس نگاهى افكند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه نظر انداخت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس باز اندیشه کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: باز هم نگریست و دقّت کرد. [[«نَظَرَ»: ساخته و پرداخته خود را مورد نگرش و بازرسی مجدّد قرار داد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس بازنگریست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس نگاهی افکند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نگریست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه انديشه كرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آن‌گاه نظر افکند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he looked around,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then dared to lift his gaze.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then he beheld,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then looked he,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he thought;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he looked.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He looked (at others);

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he thought.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then looked he,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he looked;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then he looked,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then he considered [again];

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: May he be condemned again for his schemes! He looked around,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he looked,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma nathara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he looked round;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then he looked round;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس چهره درهم کشید و قیافه نفرت آمیز به خود گرفت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati

verses.text: وَ مَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ‌ النَّارِ إِلاَّ مَلاَئِکَةً وَ مَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ‌ إِلاَّ فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ أُوتُوا الْکِتَابَ‌ وَ يَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا إِيمَاناً وَ لاَ يَرْتَابَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ أُوتُوا الْکِتَابَ‌ وَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ‌ وَ لِيَقُولَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ فِي‌ قُلُوبِهِمْ‌ مَرَضٌ‌ وَ الْکَافِرُونَ‌ مَا ذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ‌ بِهٰذَا مَثَلاً کَذٰلِکَ‌ يُضِلُ‌ اللَّهُ‌ مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ وَ يَهْدِي‌ مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ وَ مَا يَعْلَمُ‌ جُنُودَ رَبِّکَ‌ إِلاَّ هُوَ وَ مَا هِيَ‌ إِلاَّ ذِکْرَى‌ لِلْبَشَرِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما موکّلان آتش را جز فرشتگان قرار نداده ایم، و شماره آنان را جز آزمایشی برای کافران مقرّر نکرده ایم تا اهل کتاب [به خاطر هماهنگی قرآن با کتابشان] یقین پیدا کنند و بر ایمان مؤمنان بیفزاید، و اهل کتاب و مؤمنان [در حقّانیّت قرآن] تردید نکنند، و تا بیماردلان و کافران بگویند: خدا از توصیف گماشتگان آتش به این [نوزده نفر] چه هدفی دارد؟ این گونه خدا هر که را بخواهد [پس از بیان حقیقت] گمراه می کند و هر که را بخواهد هدایت می نماید، و سپاهیان پروردگارت را جز خود او کسی نمی داند، و این قرآن فقط مایه تذکر و پند برای بشر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موكلان دوزخ را جز از فرشتگان قرارنداديم. و شمار آنها جز براى امتحان كافران نيست. تا اهل كتاب يقين كنند و بر ايمان مؤمنان بيفزايد و اهل كتاب و مؤمنان شك نكنند. و تا آنان كه در دلهاشان مرضى است نگويند: خدا از اين مثَل چه مى‌خواسته است؟ خدا اينچنين هر كس را كه بخواهد گمراه مى‌كند و هر كس را كه بخواهد راه مى‌نمايد. و شمار سپاهيان پروردگارت را جز او نداند. و اين سخن جز اندرزى از براى مردم نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما آتشبانان را جز فرشتگانى قرار نداديم، و تعداد آنها را جز براى امتحان كافران مقرر نكرديم، تا آنان كه اهل كتابند به يقين برسند [كه پيامبر حق است، چون اين مطلب در كتاب آنها نيز هست،] و بر ايمان مؤمنان [نيز] بيفزايد، و اهل كتاب و مؤمنان [در حقانيت قر

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ما موكّلان آتش را جز فرشتگان نگردانيديم، و شماره آنها را جز آزمايشى براى كسانى كه كافر شده‌اند قرار نداديم، تا آنان كه اهل كتابند يقين به هم رسانند، و ايمان كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌اند افزون گردد، و آنان كه كتاب به ايشان داده شده و [نيز] مؤمنان به شك نيفتند، و تا كسانى كه در دلهايشان بيمارى است و كافران بگويند: «خدا از اين وصف‌كردن، چه چيزى را اراده كرده است؟» اين گونه، خدا هر كه را بخواهد بيراه مى‌گذارد و هر كه را بخواهد هدايت مى كند، و [شماره‌] سپاهيان پروردگارت را جز او نمى‌داند، و اين [آيات‌] جز تذكارى براى بشر نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما خازنان دوزخ را غیر فرشتگان (عذاب) قرار ندادیم و عدد آنها را جز برای فتنه و محنت کفّار (نوزده) نگردانیدیم تا آنکه اهل کتاب هم یقین کنند (که ذکر این عدد مطابق تورات و انجیل است با آنکه صاحب قرآن به کتب آسمانی عالم نبوده و البته کلامش به وحی خداست و ایمان آرند) و آن بر یقین مؤمنان هم بیفزاید و دیگر در دل اهل کتاب و مؤمنان به اسلام هیچ شک و ریبی نماند و تا آنان که در دلهاشان مرض (شک و جهالت) است و کافران نیز (به طعنه) گویند که خدا از این مثل (که عدد فرشتگان عذاب را نوزده شمرده است نه بیش و کم) چه منظور داشت؟ بلی این چنین (قرار داد تا) هر که را خواهد به ضلالت بگذارد و هر که را خواهد هدایت نماید و هیچ کس از (عده بی‌حد) لشکرهای پروردگارت غیر او آگاه نیست و این (آیات ذکر دوزخ) جز برای پند و موعظه بشر نخواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مأموران دوزخ را جز از میان فرشتگان برنگزیده‌ایم، و شماره‌ی آنان را نیز جز آزمایش کافران نساخته‌ایم. هدف این است که اهل کتاب یقین و اطمینان حاصل کنند (که آنچه قرآن درباره‌ی خازنان دوزخ می‌گوید، از طرف خدا است) و بر ایمان مؤمنان نیز بیفزاید، و اهل کتاب و مؤمنان (درباره‌ی حقّانیّت این کتاب آسمانی) تردید به خود راه ندهند، و کسانی که در دلشان بیماری (نفاق) است، و کافران بگویند: خدا مثلاً از بیان این (چنین عددی) چه می‌خواسته است؟ این گونه خداوند هرکس را بخواهد گمراه می‌سازد، و هرکس را بخواهد هدایت می‌بخشد. لشکرهای پروردگارت را جز او کسی نمی‌داند، و این جز اندرزی برای مردم نیست. [[«فِتْنَةً»: امتحان. آزمایش. «لِیَسْتَیْقِنَ الَّذِینَ ...»: یقین حاصل کردن اهل کتاب بدان خاطر است که شماره نوزده، در کتابهای خودشان نیز همین است. «مَرَضٌ»: مراد بیماری نفاق، یا شکّ است. «مَثَلاً»: حال است. «مَاذَا ... مَثَلاً»: (نگا: بقره / 26). «هِیَ»: مرجع آن سقر، و یا جنود، و یا این که آیات قرآن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما نگهبانان آتش دوزخ را جز از فرشتگان نگماشته‌ایم، و شماره آنان را جز آزمونی برای کافران نگردانده‌ایم، تا سرانجام اهل کتاب یقینی افزونتر یابند، و اهل ایمان، بر ایمان خود بیفزایند، و اهل کتاب و مؤمنان [/مسلمانان‌] شک و شبهه نورزند، و تا سرانجام بیماردلان و کافران بگویند، خداوند از این توصیف چه می‌خواهد؟ بدین‌سان خداوند هر کس را بخواهد بیراه می‌گذارد، و هر کس را بخواهد به راه می‌آورد، و سپاهیان پروردگارت را کسی جز خود او نمی‌شناسد، و این جز پندآموزی برای بشر نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مأموران دوزخ را فقط فرشتگان (عذاب) قرار دادیم، و تعداد آنها را جز برای آزمایش کافران معیّن نکردیم تا اهل کتاب [= یهود و نصاری‌] یقین پیدا کنند و بر ایمان مؤمنان بیفزاید، و اهل کتاب و مؤمنان (در حقّانیّت این کتاب آسمانی) تردید به خود راه ندهند، و بیماردلان و کافران بگویند: «خدا از این توصیف چه منظوری دارد؟!» (آری) این گونه خداوند هر کس را بخواهد گمراه می‌سازد و هر کس را بخواهد هدایت می‌کند! و لشکریان پروردگارت را جز او کسی نمی‌داند، و این جز هشدار و تذکّری برای انسانها نیست!

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما دوزخبانان را جز فرشتگان نساختيم، و شمار آنها- نوزده- را جز آزمونى براى كسانى كه كافرند نكرديم، تا اهل كتاب- جهودان و ترسايان- يقين كنند- كه پيامبر ما راستگو و بر حق است و آنچه مى‌گويد از وحى مى‌گويد چنانكه نظير آن در تورات و انجيل هست- و كسانى را كه ايمان آورده‌اند ايمان بيفزايد- چون از اهل كتاب بشنوند كه آنچه پيامبر ما گفت حق است دلگرم‌تر و استوارتر شوند- و تا اهل كتاب و مؤمنان شك نكنند، و نيز براى آنكه كسانى كه در دلهاشان بيمارى است- منافقان- و كافران بگويند: خدا از اين وصف- شمار دوزخيان- چه خواسته است؟ بدين گونه خداوند هر كه را خواهد گمراه مى‌كند و هر كه را خواهد راه مى‌نمايد و [شمار] سپاهيان پروردگارت را جز او نداند، و اين- ذكر سَقَر و دوزخبانان- براى آدمى جز ياد و پندى نيست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و ما موکلان آتش را جز فرشتگان نگردانیدیم، و شماره‌ی آنان را جز آزمایشی آتشبار برای کسانی که کافر شده‌اند قرار ندادیم. تا آنان که اهل کتابند یقین کنند و ایمان کسانی که ایمان آوردند افزون گردد و آنان که کتاب به ایشان داده شده و (نیز) مؤمنان‌، به شک مستندی نیفتند. و تا کسانی که در دل‌هایشان بیماری است و (نیز) کافران بگویند: «خدا از این مَثَل چه چیزی را اراده کرده است‌؟» این گونه خدا هر که را بخواهد بی‌راه می‌گذارد و هرکه را بخواهد به راه می‌آورد. و (شماره‌ی) سپاهیان پروردگارت را جز او نمی‌داند. و این (آیات) جز یادواره‌ای برای بشر نیست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have not appointed any one but angels as keepers of Hell, and their number that We have fixed is to make it a means of contention for disbelievers, so that those who were given the Book may be certain, and the faith of the believers may have greater increase, and the people of the Book and believers may not be deceived, and the sceptics and infidels may say: "What does God mean by this parable?" That is how God leads whosoever He will astray, and guides whosoever He will. None knows the armies of your Lord save Him self. This is no more than reminder for mankind.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have not appointed the guards of hell, except angels; and did not keep this number except to test the disbelievers – in order that the People given the Book(s) may be convinced, and to increase the faith of the believers – and so that the People given the Book(s) and the Muslims may not have any doubt – and so that those in whose hearts is a disease and the disbelievers, may say, “What does Allah mean by this amazing example?” This is how Allah sends astray whomever He wills, and guides whomever He wills; and no one knows the armies of Allah except Him; and this is not but an advice to man.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We have appointed only angels to be masters of the Fire, and their number We have appointed only as a trial for the unbelievers, that those who were given the Book may have certainty, and that those who believe may increase in belief, and that those who were given the Book and those who believe may not be in-doubt, and that those in whose hearts there is sickness, and the unbelievers, may say, 'What did God intend by this as a similitude?' So God leads astray whomsoever He will, and He guides whomsoever He will; and none knows the hosts of thy Lord but He. And it is naught but a Reminder to mortals.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have appointed none but the angels to be wardens of the Fire. And their number we have made only a trial for those who disbelieve, so that those who are vouchsafed the Book may be convinced, and that those who believe may increase in faith, and that those who are vouchsafed the Book and the believers may not doubt, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the infidels may say: what meaneth Allah by this description! In this wise Allah sendeth astray whomsoever He will, and guideth whomsoever He will. And none knoweth the hosts of thy Lord but He. And it is naught but an admonition Unto man.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We have set none but angels as guardians of the Fire, and We have fixed their number (19) only as a trial for the disbelievers, in order that the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) may arrive at a certainty [that this Quran is the truth as it agrees with their Books i.e. their number (19) is written in the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] and the believers may increase in Faith (as this Quran is the truth) and that no doubts may be left for the people of the Scripture and the believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the disbelievers may say: "What Allah intends by this (curious) example?" Thus Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none can know the hosts of your Lord but He. And this (Hell) is nothing else than a (warning) reminder to mankind.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and caused their number to be a stumbling block for those who disbelieve; so that those given the Scripture may attain certainty; and those who believe may increase in faith; and those given the Scripture and the believers may not doubt; and those in whose hearts is sickness and the unbelievers may say, “What did God intend by this parable?” Thus God leads astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. None knows the soldiers of your Lord except He. This is nothing but a reminder for the mortals.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have appointed none but angels as the keepers of the Fire, and We have not made their number but as a trial for the unbelievers so that those who have been endowed with the Book will be convinced and the believers' faith will increase, and neither those who have been endowed with the Book nor the believers will fall into any doubt. As for those in whose hearts there is a sickness as well as the unbelievers, they will say: “What did Allah aim at by this strange parable?” Thus does Allah let whomsoever He pleases to go astray, and directs whomsoever He pleases to the Right Way. And none knows the hosts of your Lord but He. (And Hell has only been mentioned here) that people may take heed.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We have set none but angels as guardians of the Fire. And We have fixed their number only as a trial for the disbelievers, in order that the People of the Scripture may arrive at a certainty and that the believers may increase in faith, and that no doubt may be left for the People of the Scripture and the believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the disbelievers may say: "What does Allah intend by this example" Thus Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none can know the hosts of your Lord but He. And this is nothing but a reminder to mankind.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and their number have We made to be a stumbling-block for those who disbelieve; that those to whom the Scripture hath been given may have certainty, and that believers may increase in faith; and that those to whom the Scripture hath been given and believers may not doubt; and that those in whose hearts there is disease, and disbelievers, may say: What meaneth Allah by this similitude? Thus Allah sendeth astray whom He will, and whom He will He guideth. None knoweth the hosts of thy Lord save Him. This is naught else than a Reminder unto mortals.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We have assigned only angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have made their number merely a stumbling block for the faithless, and so that those who were given the Book may be reassured, and the faithful may increase in [their] faith, and so that those who were given the Book and the faithful may not be in doubt, and so that the faithless and those in whose hearts is a sickness may say, ‘What did Allah mean by this description?’ Thus does Allah lead astray whomever He wishes and guides whomever He wishes. No one knows the hosts of your Lord except Him, and it is just an admonition for all humans.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have appointed none but angels to guard the Fire, and made their number only as a trial for the unbelievers, so that those to whom the Book was given are certain and those who believe increase in belief. And that those who were given the Book, and those who believe will not be in doubt. And that those in whose hearts there is a sickness, together with the unbelievers, may say: 'What did Allah intend by this as an example' As such, Allah leaves in error whom He will and He guides whomsoever He will. None knows the hosts of your Lord except He. This is no more than a Reminder to humans.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is hypocrisy and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allah leave astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And mention of the Fire is not but a reminder to humanity.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have made only angels as the keepers of the fire (for they are the strongest in carrying out Our commands). Our informing (people) of the numbers of these angels is a trial for the disbelievers. It gives more certainty to the people of the Book and strengthens the faith of the believers. The people of the Book and the believers have no doubt about it. We have fixed the number to make the disbelievers and those whose hearts are sick say, "What does God mean by such a parable?" Thus, God guides and causes to go astray whomever He wants. No one knows about the army of your Lord except He Himself. This parable is a reminder for mankind.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We have not made the wardens of the fire others than angels, and We have not made their number but as a trial for those who disbelieve, that those who have been given the book may be certain and those who believe may increase in faith, and those who have been given the book and the believers may not doubt, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the unbelievers may say: What does Allah mean by this parable? Thus does Allah make err whom He pleases, and He guides whom He pleases, and none knows the hosts of your Lord but He Himself; and this is naught but a reminder to the mortals.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama jaAAalna ashaba alnnari illa malaikatan wama jaAAalna AAiddatahum illa fitnatan lillatheena kafaroo liyastayqina allatheena ootoo alkitaba wayazdada allatheena amanoo eemanan wala yartaba allatheena ootoo alkitaba waalmuminoona waliyaqoola allatheena fee quloobihim maradun waalkafiroona matha arada Allahu bihatha mathalan kathalika yudillu Allahu man yashao wayahdee man yashao wama yaAAlamu junooda rabbika illa huwa wama hiya illa thikra lilbashari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire. We have specified their number only as a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth, so that those who were given the Book might gain in certainty, and those who believe might increase in faith -- and so that neither those who have been given the Scripture nor the believers might have any doubts, and that those sick at heart and those who deny the truth might ask, "What does God mean by this parable?" In this way, God lets go astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. And none knows the forces of your Lord but He. This is but a Reminder for man.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We have set none but angels as Guardians of the Fire; and We have fixed their number only as a trial for Unbelievers,- in order that the People of the Book may arrive at certainty, and the Believers may increase in Faith,- and that no doubts may be left for the People of the Book and the Believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the Unbelievers may say, "What symbol doth Allah intend by this?" Thus doth Allah leave to stray whom He pleaseth, and guide whom He pleaseth: and none can know the forces of thy Lord, except He and this is no other than a warning to mankind.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین نیست [که کافران می پندارند که این حقایق افسانه است،] سوگند به ماه

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آرى، سوگند به ماه.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نه چنين است [كه مى‌پندارند]، سوگند به ماه

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه چنين است [كه مى‌پندارند!] سوگند به ماه،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چنین (که کافران گویند) نیست، قسم به ماه تابان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این چنین نیست که ایشان می‌پندارند! سوگند به ماه! [[«وَالْقَمَرِ»: سوگند خداوند به آفریده‌های خود از جمله ماه، به خاطر جلب توجّه بدانها از نظر خِلقت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین نیست [که گویند]، سوگند به ماه‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اینچنین نیست که آنها تصوّر می‌کنند سوگند به ماه،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است سوگند به ماه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه چنان است [كه كافران و منكران گويند] سوگند به ماه،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نه چنین است (که می‌پندارند)! سوگند به ماه،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I say the truth, and call the moon to witness,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Yes, never!* By oath of the moon. (Hell will never spare the disbelievers).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay! By the moon

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! By the moon,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, and by the moon,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Nay! By the moon.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nay, by the moon,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay! And by the moon.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, by the Moon

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No indeed! By the Moon!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, by the moon!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! By the moon

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: By the moon,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay; I swear by the moon,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla waalqamari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No, by the moon!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay, verily: By the Moon,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [و] سوگند به شب هنگامی که پشت می کند

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سوگند به شب، چون روى در رفتن آرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سوگند به شب چون پشت كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و سوگند به شامگاه چون پشت كند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قسم به شب تار چون باز گردد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و سوگند به شب بدان گاه که پشت کند (و دامن برچیند و روی به رفتن آرد!). [[«أَدْبَرَ»: پشت کرد و رفت. دامن برچید و روی به رفتن آورد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و شب چون بگذرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به شب، هنگامی که (دامن برچیند و) پشت کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و شب گاهی که روی برتابد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سوگند به شب چون پشت كند و برود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوگند به شامگاه چون پشت کند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And the night when on the wane,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of the night when it turns back.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the night when it retreats

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the night when it with draweth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by the night when it withdraws,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the night as it retreats.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by the night when it recedes,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And by the night when it withdraws.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the night when it withdraweth

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: By the night when it recedes!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: By the receding night

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [by] the night when it departs

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: by the retreating night,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the night when it departs,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallayli ith adbara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By the night when it departs.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And by the Night as it retreateth,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و سوگند به صبح زمانی که از پرده سیاه شب درآید و رخ نماید

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سوگند به صبح، چون پرده برافكند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سوگند به بامداد چون رخ نمايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و سوگند به بامداد چون آشكار شود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قسم به صبح چون جهان را روشن سازد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و سوگند به صبح، چون (نقاب از چهره برگیرد، و پرده برافکند، و) روشن گردد! [[«أَسْفَرَ»: روشن گردید. این فعل در اصل به معنی از چهره نقاب برگرفتن و کشف حجاب کردن است، و این تعبیر درباره طلوع صبح و سپیده بامدادان، از راه تشبیه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و] سوگند به صبح چون روشن شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به صبح هنگامی که چهره بگشاید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بامداد گاهی که رخ گشاید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سوگند به صبح چون رخ نمايد و روشن شود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوگند به بامداد چون چهره گشاید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The morning when it is unveiled,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of the morning, when it spreads light.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the dawn when it is white,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the morning when it brighteneth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by the dawn when it brightens,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the morning as it lights up.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And by the dawn when it brightens.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the dawn when it shineth forth,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: By the dawn when it brightens!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and the morning when it appears,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [by] the morning when it brightens,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: by the brightening dawn,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the daybreak when it shines;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalssubhi itha asfara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By the dawn when it lightens!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And by the Dawn as it shineth forth,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که بی تردید این [قرآن] از بزرگ ترین پدیده هاست؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه اين يكى از حادثه‌هاى بزرگ است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه قطعا آن [قيامت يا قرآن‌] يكى از بزرگ‌ترين پديده‌هاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه آيات [قرآن‌] از پديده‌هاى بزرگ است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که این (آیات قرآن) یکی از بزرگترین آیات خداست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دوزخ (یکی از مسائل مهمّ و حوادث عظیم، اصلاً) بلائی از بلاهای بزرگ است. [[«إِنَّهَا»: ضمیر (ها) به سقر برمی‌گردد. برخی هم آن را به (جُنُود) و یا مجموعه حوادث قیامت برمی‌گردانند. هر کدام که باشد، عظمت آن روشن است. «الْکُبَرِ»: جمع کُبْری، بلای بزرگ. حادثه مهمّ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آن یکی از سترگهاست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که آن (حوادث هولناک قیامت) از مسائل مهم است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که آن است همانا یکی از گرانها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه آن- سَقَر- يكى از پديده‌هاى بزرگ است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌راستی آیات (قرآن) بی‌گمان یکی از (آیات) بزرگ است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That (Hell) is surely one of the greater (signs),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed hell is one of the greatest entities.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: surely it is one of the greatest things

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مانند گورخران رميده‌

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گويى آنان خرانى رمنده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گويى گورخرانى رميده‌اند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گویی گورخران گریزانی هستند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: انگار آنان گورخران رمنده‌ای هستند. [[«حُمُرٌ»: جمع حِمار، گورخر. «مُسْتَنفِرَةٌ»: گریز پا. رمنده. چموش. ذکر آن از باب استفعال برای مبالغه در رمندگی و چموشی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گویی درازگوشانی رمانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گویی گورخرانی رمیده‌اند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گوئیا آنانند خران رمنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گويى كه گورخرانى رميده‌اند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که گویی بی‌گمان گورخرانی رمیده‌اند،

translations.text: As though they were asses startled."

translations.text: As if they were frightened (wild) donkeys.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As though they were panicked donkeys.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi

translations.text: As if they were wild donkeys.

translations.text: as if they were terrified asses

translations.text: like startled wild donkeys

translations.text: As if they were alarmed donkeys

translations.text: Kaannahum humurun mustanfiratun

translations.text: like frightened donkeys

translations.text: As if they were affrighted asses,

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه از شير مى‌گريزند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه از شيرى گريخته‌اند

translations.text: كه از (مقابل) شيرى فرار كرده‌اند!

translations.text: که از شیر درنده می‌گریزند.

translations.text: گورخرانی که از شیر گریخته و رمیده باشند. [[«قَسْوَرَةٍ»: شیر.]]

translations.text: که از شیر می‌گریزند

translations.text: که از (مقابل) شیری فرار کرده‌اند!

translations.text: که گریخته‌اند از شیری ژیان‌

translations.text: كه از شير- يا شكارچى- گريخته‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که‌) از مقابل شیری ژیان فرار کرده‌اند!

translations.text: Fleeing away from a lion.

translations.text: Fleeing away from a lion.

translations.text: Fleeing from a hunter, or a lion, or a beast of prey.

translations.text: Fleeing from a lion?

translations.text: Fleeing from a Qaswarah.
